title: X650->ZZ/WW/H125H95/A450Z -- scalar, tensor or both ?
abstract:
At ICHEP 2024 CMS has published RUN2 results for X650->ZZ->4leptons and
reached the conclusion that there is no evidence for a scalar resonance H650
decaying into ZZ, as was also concluded by ATLAS using an MVA analysis
optimised for a scalar particle. Since this resonance is indicated into ZZ in a
Cut Based Analysis and into three other modes: WW, H95H125 and A450Z, the
present paper is an attempt to understand these apparent contradictions. Our
conclusion, to be confirmed by ATLAS and CMS experiments, is that strict
selections for the reaction H650->ZZ mode seem inadequate, cutting as much into
the signal than into the background, therefore reducing its statistical
significance. A possible interpretation of this behaviour is that these
selections are inefficient for a tensor particle produced by VBF and decaying
into ZZ with an angular distributions similar to the Drell Yan background. If
true, our description of the various findings in term of the Georgi Machacek
model needs to be deeply revised, which is attempted in the present note. A
scenario with T650 as a tensor resonance is presented which naturally
accommodates WW/ZZ and H95H125 decays, while we suggest that A450Z coud come
from a scalar resonance degenerate in mass with T650.
